header_summary:
In a discussion led by Mark Erhardt and Antoine Riard, the conversation delved into refining a proposal for Bitcoin development, touching upon the necessity for clear objectives and amendments, including the suggestion to separate the nomination process for Bitcoin Improvement Proposal (BIP) Editors into its own proposal to maintain focus on the main objectives [source](https://gnusha.org/pi/bitcoindev/CAMHHROw9mZJRnTbUo76PdqwJU==YJMvd9Qrst+nmyypaedYZgg@mail.gmail.com/T/#m82e3c7fa86ff8755b24bf69a9b43f432e0631363). Ava Chow announced the availability of Bitcoin Core version v28.0rc2 binaries, highlighting the significance of the release candidate phase for rigorous testing before the final version launch, with details accessible via [Bitcoin Core's official website](https://bitcoincore.org/bin/bitcoin-core-28.0/test.rc2) and [GitHub](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/tree/v28.0rc2).

Antoine Riard raised a discussion on the removal of checkpoints in Bitcoin Core, pointing to a GitHub pull request as evidence of ongoing efforts to enhance security measures within the system, underscoring the dynamic and complex nature of Bitcoin Core's security [GitHub PR](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/25725). Meanwhile, discussions by ZmnSCPxj and Carla centered on optimizing Bitcoin transactions through Lightning Service Providers (LSPs) and the management of Hashed Timelock Contracts (HTLCs), respectively, emphasizing strategies for liquidity and integrity in transactions, with insights shared on [DelvingBitcoin.org](https://delvingbitcoin.org/t/superscalar-laddered-timeout-tree-structured-decker-wattenhofer-factories/1143/9) and [another page](https://delvingbitcoin.org/t/hybrid-jamming-mitigation-results-and-updates/1147/3).

Lastly, a perspective offered by 1440000bytes on Bitcoin's ossification process challenges the community to consider broader socio-political and economic influences beyond the technical mechanisms like halving events, suggesting that real-world power dynamics and strategic interventions by influential stakeholders could shape Bitcoin's future [source](https://delvingbitcoin.org/t/modeling-social-consensus-about-cryptographic-consensus-change/1136/3).

recent_posts.title: Adding New BIP Editors
recent_posts.summary:
- Mark Erhardt discussed proposal development with Antoine Riard.
- Amendments and a separate BIP for nominating Editors were suggested.
- The conversation aimed at clear, focused proposal objectives.

recent_posts.title: Bitcoin Core 28.0 Release Candidate 2 Available
recent_posts.summary:
- Bitcoin Core version v28.0rc2 binaries are now available for download.
- The release candidate phase signifies close to the official launch of version 28.0.
- Users can test and report issues, aiming for widespread deployment after approval.

recent_posts.title: Public disclosure of 1 vulnerability affecting Bitcoin Core <24.0.1
recent_posts.summary:
- The new Bitcoin Core development avoids reliance on checkpoints for attack protection.
- Ongoing GitHub pull discussions aim at improving Bitcoin Core's security and efficiency.
- Despite beliefs, checkpoints exist in Bitcoin Core as per the latest commit mentioned.

recent_posts.title: SuperScalar: Laddered Timeout-Tree-Structured Decker-Wattenhofer Factories
recent_posts.summary:
- Lightning Service Providers optimize Bitcoin transactions by managing UTXOs efficiently.
- They may manage two channels per client, reducing the need for multiple UTXOs.
- A strategy involving `CLTV` consolidates channels, improving blockchain resource use.

recent_posts.title: Hybrid Jamming Mitigation: Results and Updates
recent_posts.summary:
- Nodes manage HTLCs by evaluating transactions based on reputation and position.
- Decisions on HTLC forwarding incorporate reputational assessments to mitigate risk and ensure integrity.
- Mutual trust and reputation among nodes enhance security and reliability within the network.

recent_posts.title: Modeling (Social) Consensus About (Cryptographic) Consensus Change
recent_posts.summary:
- The theory suggests Bitcoin's evolution is influenced by factors beyond halving events.
- Influential figures and financial stakeholders actively shape Bitcoin’s trajectory.
- This perspective invites considering broader socio-political forces in Bitcoin's ossification.

today_in_history_posts.title: Floating-Point Nakamoto Consensus
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- ZmnSCPxj addresses the critical need for clarity in mining consensus to prevent security risks.
- An exploit reported to the Bitcoin-core team challenges the Nakamoto consensus method.
- ZmnSCPxj proposes extending the standard 90-day disclosure period to ensure thorough resolution.

today_in_history_posts.title: Why should funders always pay on-chain fees?
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- The proposal discusses splitting commit-tx on-chain fees between funder and fundee in Lightning Network.
- It suggests charging nodes for HTLCs they offer to mitigate risks and incentivize care for on-chain fee rates.
- Feedback is sought on the proposal, despite concerns about its complexity and potential for negative impacts.

today_in_history_posts.title: Covenant tools softfork
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- The proposed softfork plans to activate BIP-118, BIP-119, and BIP-345, enhancing Bitcoin's functionality.
- BIP-345's rapid deployment potential is highlighted by existing wallet implementations and demand for safer custody.
- The softfork's codebase is manageable for review, with a draft PR for BIP-345 activation pending community feedback.
